SENT.plain: The Muckle and Well's syndrome corresponding to a transmission of the autosomic dominant type, combines bouts of urticaria, episodes of arthralgias to a shrinking of the ear and a sensory deafness
Sometimes, it evolves into a renal amylosis
Sometimes, as the case presented here, it combines multiple malformations
Its place in nosology is imprecise
It is, at the same time, close to systemic urticaria, sensory deafness, amylosis and specially amylosis of the periodic disease
But the common link between the various elements of the syndrome remains undetermined, for the time being
